items.content_html:
The output of the update-browser-releases script is:

@mdn/browser-compat-data@5.7.0 update-browser-releases
tsx scripts/update-browser-releases/index.ts --all

Updates for Edge for Desktop

Section not found in official release notes for Edge 134.0.3124.51

  • New status for edge 134: current, previously beta.
  • New status for edge 133: retired, previously current.

Note

Opera for Desktop: No release announcement found among 10 items in this RSS feed.

Note

Opera for Android: No release announcement found among 15 items in this RSS feed.
items.title: Update browser releases

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects the metadata (spec URLs, descriptions, statuses, etc.) for the SpeechGrammar API.

Additional Notes: Removed from spec in WebAudio/web-speech-api#117.
items.title: Update metadata for SpeechGrammar API

items.content_html: This PR removes the MLNumber member of the MLOperand API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.
items.title: Remove api.MLOperand.MLNumber from BCD

items.content_html:
The @openwebdocs BCD collector project v10.12.10 found new features shipping in Chrome 135 beta which was released yesterday. Currently, the collector covers about 90% of BCD, so the following list might not be exhaustive. Also, if a feature is in Chrome Canary/behind origin trials/enrollment, it is not considered here.

With this PR, BCD considers the following 56 features as shipping in Chrome 135:

  • api.CanvasRenderingContext2D.lang
  • api.CommandEvent
  • api.CommandEvent.CommandEvent
  • api.CommandEvent.command
  • api.CommandEvent.source
  • api.Element.ariaActiveDescendantElement
  • api.Element.ariaControlsElements
  • api.Element.ariaDescribedByElements
  • api.Element.ariaDetailsElements
  • api.Element.ariaErrorMessageElements
  • api.Element.ariaFlowToElements
  • api.Element.ariaLabelledByElements
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaActiveDescendantElement
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaControlsElements
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaDescribedByElements
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaDetailsElements
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaErrorMessageElements
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaFlowToElements
  • api.ElementInternals.ariaLabelledByElements
  • api.FetchLaterResult
  • api.FetchLaterResult.activated
  • api.GPUSupportedLimits.maxInterStageShaderComponents
  • api.HTMLButtonElement.command
  • api.HTMLButtonElement.commandForElement
  • api.HTMLElement.command_event
  • api.NavigateEvent.sourceElement
  • api.OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D.lang
  • api.Window.fetchLater
  • css.properties.dynamic-range-limit
  • css.properties.dynamic-range-limit.constrained-high
  • css.properties.dynamic-range-limit.high
  • css.properties.dynamic-range-limit.standard
  • css.properties.interactivity
  • css.properties.interactivity.auto
  • css.properties.interactivity.inert
  • css.properties.overflow-block
  • css.properties.overflow-block.overlay
  • css.properties.overflow-inline
  • css.properties.overflow-inline.overlay
  • css.properties.scroll-marker-group
  • css.properties.scroll-marker-group.after
  • css.properties.scroll-marker-group.before
  • css.properties.scroll-marker-group.none
  • css.selectors.scroll-marker-group
  • css.selectors.scroll-marker
  • css.selectors.target-current
  • css.types.abs
  • css.types.basic-shape.shape
  • css.types.sign
  • html.elements.button.command
  • html.elements.button.commandfor
  • javascript.builtins.DataView.getFloat16
  • javascript.builtins.DataView.setFloat16
  • javascript.builtins.Float16Array
  • javascript.builtins.Float16Array.Float16Array
  • javascript.builtins.Math.f16round

See also the 135 "Enabled by default" column on https://chromestatus.com/roadmap and https://developer.chrome.com/blog/chrome-135-beta

Notes from looking at Chromestatus for 135:

  • Aria Element Reflection https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/j8nZWueWc1s/m/gQgL7415AAAJ Chromestatus is outdated, I think the collector is correct that this is shipping https://chromestatus.com/feature/6244885579431936
  • ::column is said to ship and the spec says "it only exists on multi-column containers", so here we need to make the collector test more clever to detect support.
  • require-sri-for seems to be in but the spec has not been merged, https://chromestatus.com/feature/5090023365672960, w3c/webappsec-subresource-integrity#129.
  • dynamic-range-limit slipped to 135 https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/cG_ZCeQaWQs/m/LRU22h5AAQAJ
  • HighlightRegistry.highlightsFromPoint (https://chromestatus.com/feature/4552801607483392) - doesn't work for me in Chrome 135 beta. Some discussions ongoing in https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/8OpfR1m_zjU/m/4nr01-gBAQAJ
  • CSS *progress() functions (https://chromestatus.com/feature/5112558941634560) - The collector doesn't test these yet. May be supported.
  • Observable (https://chromestatus.com/feature/5154593776599040). Not working for me or in the collector in Chrome 135 beta.
  • max-area-safe-inset-* (https://chromestatus.com/feature/6393888941801472) - The collector doesn't test these yet. May be supported.
  • ::scroll-button() (https://chromestatus.com/feature/5093129273999360) - The collector doesn't test this yet. May be supported.
  • SVGAElement.rel/relList (https://chromestatus.com/feature/5066982694846464). Collector says no support. The intent is quite new (https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/IwPL1cB_CkY/m/hLsYDBpeAAAJ). Probably slipped to 136?
  • FetchLater - we have no spec yet. See whatwg/fetch#1647 but I see support for it. Added without spec.

cc @rachelandrew
items.title: Updates for Chrome 135 beta

items.content_html:
This PR introduces a top-level manifests/ folder. This folder will eventually store more types of manifests; currently, it only holds the webapp manifests, which were moved from html.manifest.

Fixes #18493.
items.title: Introduce top-level Manifest folder

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds an entry for the new request-close invoker command (matches dialog.requestClose())

Test results and supporting details

WIP until this is enabled (behind a flag or not) in at least one browser.

Related issues

mdn/content#38322
items.title: Add entry for request-close invoker command

items.content_html:
Summary

Addresses the dev-docs-needed requirements for Bug 1659500 Disable contextualIdentities API until GeckoView's container feature is implemented correctly

Release note added in mdn/content#38427
items.title: Bug-1659500 `contextualIdentities` API undefined in Firefox for Android

items.content_html:
Summary

This creates more symmetry between font-stretch and font-width data.

Test results and supporting details

  • Adds the <percentage> value to the font-width tree, to match font-stretch and fully cover the expected values and types for font-width.
  • Copies the font-width data into the @font-face tree, as a descriptor.

Related issues

  • #26039
  • #26060
  • web-platform-dx/web-features#2707
items.title: Add more `font-width` data

items.content_html:
Summary

Breaking change: Changes the browsers.*.releases property from an object to an array, moving the version number inside the ReleaseStatement.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #21124.
items.title: feat(schemas/browser)!: changes releases from object to array

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds api.HTMLElement.load_event.

Test results and supporting details

Copied from api.Window.load_event.

Related issues

Fixes #19595.
items.title: Add load_event on HTMLElement

items.content_html:
Summary

HTTP responses with 204, 304, (1XX) should not contain content (a body). For historical / legacy reasons, browsers have tolerated junk data in <=HTTP/1.1 that precedes the status line because servers occasionally included content in responses that should not have a body. HTTP spec versions after 1.1 are strict / explicit in forbidding content in these cases.

I'm removing compat info from prose in MDN docs, and putting this into compat data instead, as this seems the most appropriate place for this to live on.

204 (No Content) is the most obvious place, but I'm open to alternatives somewhere (outside of http/status.json?)

Related issues

  • mdn/content#37928
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1356614
items.title: HTTP responses for status codes that should have no body

items.content_html:
Summary

Add Firefox release for preferred_environment in the background manifest key as implemented by Bug 1930334 Implement background.preferred_environment.

Related issues

Related MDN content changes in mdn/content#37876
items.title: Firefox 136 supports webextensions.manifest.background.preferred_environment

items.content_html:
Summary

Moves env() from css.properties.custom-property to css.types.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #14668.
items.title: Move CSS `env()`/`var()` functions into `css.types.*`

items.content_html:
Summary

Changes the description of css.types.url from <url> (type) to url() (function), and links css.types.url and css.properties.content.url to Web/CSS/url_function.

Also adds a missing description to css.properties.list-style-type.symbols.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #25413.
items.title: Change `<url>` to `url()` and link to Web/CSS/url_function

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds missing support data for <meta name="viewport">.

Test results and supporting details

This PR assumes that Mobile Safari 3 for iOS shipped the first <meta name="viewport"> implementation, and all later released mobile browsers followed.

  • Firefox 4 for Android
  • Chrome 18 for Android
  • Opera Mobile 10

Thereâ€™s a viewport-fit feature that Safari 11 presumably shipped. I just learned that Chrome is planning to ship it soon, too.

Related issues

Fixes #25311
items.title: Add meta viewport support data
